meanings.definition: A four-pronged iron spike crafted so that one prong always points upward, used to hinder or injure enemy troops.
meanings.sent1: The soldier stepped on a caltrap and winced in pain.
meanings.sent2: The caltrap was strategically placed to slow down the advancing enemy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the caltrap for a nut and got a surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like caltraps, piercing through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The caltrap gleamed menacingly in the moonlight, a silent threat to any who dared approach.

meanings.definition: To scatter caltraps on the ground as a means of defense or offense.
meanings.sent1: The general ordered his troops to caltrap the battlefield before the enemy arrived.
meanings.sent2: They decided to caltrap the area to prevent any unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids thought it would be funny to caltrap the schoolyard with marbles.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to caltrap the room, stopping all conversation in its tracks.
meanings.sent5: The detective's questions were like caltraps, catching the suspect off guard at every turn.
